poem:
Title: Amid Desolation, A Vulnerability

In the still of twilight, tales of war whisper,
Solace trampled, quiet disquiet surfaces.
Two cities locked in time's grievous grip,
A dirge echoed in the wake of harsh commands.
Deeply offensive, the mirror of hatred reflects,
Multiplied, its worth in symmetry of sorrow.
And so, we are ceaselessly condemned,
By the moonlit scars we dare not forget.
